Reviews.Title: Broke after 5 months - poor service
Reviews.Author: Stewart Ruddy "off the beaten track"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, terrible service.  I loved this camera for 5 months, then the LCD had problems.  Pink vertical bars obscured the lighter portions of the display (like any outdoor shot or inside with a window on a sunny day.  I have the $99 mini Kodak, and this LCD works fine in the same conditions, so I know it is a problem.It was too late to return, so I had to get it serviced.  Kodak service is terrible.  You can't speak to anyone, and have two lines to describe the problem.  I specifically wrote that pictures were fine, but LCD had a problem.  I had to send it (at my own expense) to a "factory authorized service center" in Indiana, even though I'm in California.  I used Google Street View to look this place up, and it's just a camera shop!  Any way, some weeks later, I got the camera back with a note "lens replaced", and the problem is still there.I emailed Kodak customer service & complained.  They emailed back that they were sorry and sent me a $10 coupon for my next Kodak purchase.  No word about how to get the darn thing fixed.I've been buying Kodak cameras my entire life, but this soured me on the whole company, which, I read, was going bankrupt.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Texas Jack
Reviews.Content: I took the camera out for a test drive, and it worked well.  The camera has plenty of features, but not an overwhelming number. Resolution is excellent, both in pictures of cats and landscapes.  The screen is a bit difficult to see in full sun while wearing dark sunglasses, but I do not regard that as a defect.  The macro feature works well to resolve fine print on a business card (Note: turn off the auto-flash if you do this!).  The Kodak software (included) works well.I used an 8Gb Micro SDHC card, and the camera has a capacity of 1700 full resolution images.  Note that although the manual uses the term "Micro SD or Micro SDHC card", ONLY the SDHC card will fit.The camera is remarkably small and light, so I plan to use it frequently.  I'm glad I bought it, and recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bonita
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is really sleek and really nice looking.  All the pictures that I have taken are clear and sharp.  I have a Kodak Z950, but I wanted a small camera that would take great pictures like my Z950 and fit in my pocket.  The only problem that I have is that if you are in taking pictures outside in direct sunlight. it is hard to see what is on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good quality
Reviews.Author: Rpock
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to replace our old point and shoot kodak. The pictures come out with great quality. They are never blurry, even of my 3 year old. There's many different settings you can use to take pictures, including a fun photo booth option. I'm no professional and I've found the automatic setting to take the best pictures. It also takes videos, although not the best quality, it's the kind of quality you can expect from a camera like this. The charger is small and compact, it can plug into the wall outlet or the computer. Sharing is incredibly easy with this camera, you can mark photos before uploading to the computer and it will automatically share them with your facebook, twitter, flickr, email, or whatever you choose for each photo. You can also just upload them straight to the computer. We're very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: M583 - not built like Kodak's of old. BEWARE.
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare M583 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD - Black (New Model)I purchased this camera to replace my 6 year old Kodak DX7630, which was an awesome camera. There M583 looked to be a fairly large improvement on the DX7630, smaller, lighter, more megapixels, zoom and a 28mm lens vs 35mm. Perfect! The M583 arrived quickly, but from the first dozen photos I realised that something was wrong. Toward the top RHS of the image, a circular blur was apparent in every photo, except for close ups. I was annoyed but I knew that the replacement process through Amazon was painless so I notified them of the fault and sent the M583 back for replacement.The replacement arrived quickly enough. However after I turned the M583 on, I tried to take a photo and....nothing. The shutter bottom was broken and would not push down at all. I decided at this point not to go for a third try and sent the M583 back and asked for a refund.This has severely diminished my respect for Kodak P&S; cameras. Whereas my DX7630 still soldiers on fine after 6 years and feels like it will last another decade or so, the M583 was a plasticky, poor quality device. It's a pity, because the pictures (other than the blurring) were pretty good but not as good as my DX7630 surprisingly. Thanks for forcing me to leave you Kodak...I eventually bought a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ10 (ZS7) which I couldn't be happier with and is MILES better than the M583. Please keep my review in mind before you purchase the M583!

Reviews.Title: Easy! Nice indoor shooting! Nice Panoramic feature!
Reviews.Author: Erwin
Reviews.Content: Everything is "preset" style. No advanced programming mode but that's ok cause this is a compact camera and not a professional one. It has a programming mode but "light and easy".The wide angle lense really does its job. Indoor pictures are great even in "automatic" mode. No need to get far to cover great spaces or group of people.Movie format is MPEG-4. Ready for iPod & iPhone but if you want to display your videos as AVI or MKV, you will need to acquire a video converter. I used DivX Plus to convert files to MKV. The registered version offers AVI as well.Picture quality: great @ 14 megapixels! when viewing the pictures at the computer you can zoom on them at a great size before they get "granny". I tested the Panoramic feature and I got very impressed with it!Video quality: Sharp and colourful! I'm looking for the "anti shake mode" but still learning. Anyway, totally acceptable.Flash behaviour: the camera does control the intensity of the flash according to the enviroment and/or object distance.NOTE: it use a MicroSD card (NO a regular SD). I bought an 8gb Class 10 and works great with it.Compact, light weightThe menu dial is kind of small for big fingers. Users may gert confused between the Power button, the Movie Record button and the Shutter button. All three are aligned together.No Date In-Print for the pictures directly from the camera. The battery life is excellent. You can charge it directly from the camera or, you can buy an aftermarket charger for less than $12.Really happy with the camera! ;-)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Linda Jones "makidwell"
Reviews.Content: Accidentally broke my camera when handing it to someone and it dropped with the lens open.  I was so sad, had only had it a few months.  It was such a good camera that I went right back out and bought another one just like it.  Great picture quality, super simple to use!  Nuff said?

Reviews.Title: After 10 pictures, a flake of something was behind the lens
Reviews.Author: Cleve "good standing" Steve "McSteve"
Reviews.Content: Camera seems good enough but quality control must be bad.  Ours started showing a flake or "hair" behind the lens after about 10 pics.  Cleaned the lens well, can't see anything but it's behind the lens.  When you zoom, it comes into a little bit of focus.  Seems like a metal filing or something.  And Amazon will only refund.  We bought it for $135, now the price is up to $150.  Shouldn't they just replace it?THIS ALSO ONLY TAKES MICRO SD CARDS.  Description should mention that!

Reviews.Title: Good, But Suggested Memory Card is Wrong
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Colbath
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, no problems there. Good price, good value, thank you Kodak.The memory card that is in the "frequently bought together" section of this page is wrong. It doesn't fit. It's a standard sized card and they card you need is one of those "micro" things that's about 1/6th of the size. If you buy the "frequently" bought card, you'll end up feeling like an idiot, like me (probably rightly so). :-)

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: This is a Great camera.  I have a Nikon expensive one that every time my Grandchildren move the pictures are blurry.  This one lets them run and play and NO blur.  Love it......

Reviews.Title: Great product but Video is subpar
Reviews.Author: wesley1008
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare M583 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD - Black (New Model)This camera is very easy to use and takes great pictures. The various modes work well, especially the panoramic mode. However, I was not impressed with the video quality but I have not used it much so this may need more testing. This camera is very good and with an 8x optical zoom for this price, it is a definite bargain.

Reviews.Title: Kodak upped their game
Reviews.Author: Peter M. Honeyford "Peter H"
Reviews.Content: I had a previous Kodak dcamera. While I was very pleased with its features and photos, its casing was of average quality at best; though though camera lasted several years until it and I where totally submerged in a stream. I liked the features so much I wanted another Kodak camera. I found the M583 to have better features at a reasonable price. When it arrived I was excited to see that Kodak jacketed it in a top quality housing. This is everything I want in a point and shoot that does so much more.My main d camera is a Cannon EOS 20. I have wanted to upgrade it, but now I don't sense the urgency.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: BabyCheezus "Baby Cheezus"
Reviews.Content: The pictures turn out really nice and clear. I got the red and it's a cross between a ruby red & fuchsia. It's really beautiful. I love all the features and the fact that you can share these photos directly to facebook. I haven't used it too much but I'm already impressed with it. It comes with a usb cord that connects to the camera and the computer and the same cord can be used from the camera to the power adapter that plugs into the wall. This seems to be a good quality camera that I'm sure I'll enjoy for years to come!

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a great surprise to me. It does all kinds of stuff I never expected. I switched over from a Toshiba that took rechargable batteries. They were always dead, and even when fully charged only allowed a few pics to be taken before they died again. This one is a little bit slippery and the users manual that comes with it could be a lot more helpful. The information in it is a bit scarce. All in all I like the camera a lot.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Oakes "travistx16000"
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare M583 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD - Black (New Model)I bought mine at a pawn shop in town for half the listed price here.  This thing is incredible, reading the owners' manual and scrolling through the menus, wow.  Good news is the battery is the same design as my Olympus Stylus 1200.  I WILL buy a micro 32GB memory card, extra batteries and external charger on Amazon for this camera.  What I think is SLICK about this camera, (This makes five. similar, that I have/had: two Panasonic, one Olympus, gave my old Cannon to my son)it has a button on top for not only a photo shot but also a video recording, that is AWESOME! You don't have to FUMBLE to rotate the dial on the top or back side of the camera for an instant video shot and oh by the way, the light on the top is WELL THOUGHT OF IDEA.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures, but slow
Reviews.Author: Jewel
Reviews.Content: I've been pleased with the quality of Kodak cameras in the past, and so decided to get a Kodak camera to replace my cheap Nikon, which suffers from really bad distortion at the wide angle setting. I'm happy with the solid build of this camera (although it's not as slim/sleek as other point-and-shoots), and the picture quality overall (wide angle distortion is much less on this cam). I'm really disappointed with the lag time when taking photos, though.  It takes a while to go from one photo to the next, because the camera takes so long to 'process' the last photo. It's resulted in me missing some 'moments', and taking photos in quick succession (e.g action shots) is a no-no . I've also had a few structrual issues, with the lens sticking at one point, and the camera crashing while I was taking a picture, and refusing to be shut off. I had to take out the battery and card and leave it for a while for it to start working again.Overall,an okay camera. Nice picture quality, but could do with some improvement.

Reviews.Title: Ripped off!
Reviews.Author: Carol L. Chastain
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because it had great reviews, was from a long established American icon, and had been described as something that would be just right for me.  The first thing I learned out of the box was that the software is no longer available for download.  So sorry, says Kodak, but they just don't own the software anymore.  "Sorry for your inconvenience."  I've never heard of a theft called merely an "inconvenience".  Supposedly there are ways I can still use the camera, and I was leaving town needing something.  I got some great pictures, but I still haven't figured out how I can use them.  Customer support is from India and the reception is poor.  Though the man was patient and polite, I couldn't hear through his accent and the static. Does Amazon let sellers dump old stuff here?

Reviews.Title: No Problems at All
Reviews.Author: Susan Adrian
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews on this camera stating about blurriness and the card that comes with the camera not fitting. Let me address the bluriness issue first. If you read the manual it explains how to refocus the camera so that your photos do not have said bluriness.The other issue with the card is actually not an issue at all. I am going to assume that most people do not know how to unlock the bigger card and pull out the micro card inside, and insert that in the slot next to the battery. There is no need to purchase another card unless you want more memory.The camera works wonderfully for me. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera but It Stopped Working after 14 Days. I paid to send it in for warranty repair and it still has defects.
Reviews.Author: T. Miner
Reviews.Content: This is an update on my review of March 26, 2012This is not a camera for the faint of heart.The M583 has a number of very nice features. It takes sharp natural looking photos.Less than 2 weeks after receiving this camera it started having issues. First it would lock up with the lens extended, there was no image on the screen and the power wouldn't shut off. I removed the battery to cut the power and replaced it and it booted up and worked fine. This happened twice. Then the camera would boot but there would be no image on the screen. It would take a photo but the picture would be all black. I called Kodak support and they told me to send the camera in(my shipping expense) for repair or replacement with a refurbished unit, a process that is supposed to take about 3 weeks. I am concerned that the result may be a camera that is unreliable. I also feel they should have just replaced it due to the fact that it failed so soon after purchase.The camera was returned to me on April 9th and I assumed it was repaired. The camera was functioning and all appeared to be well. One week later on April 16th the camera froze again just as it had before sending it for repair. Then on April 22 the AC charging adapter stopped working. I was still able to charge the camera with the cord plugged into a usb port on the computer but the ac adapter is completely dead. On April 27th  I again called Kodak support and was told that I would need to send the camera back in again I was given an Activity Number, and told that I would receive an e-mail with instruction for return along with a prepaid mailing label.Six days later I had still not received the e-mail and the repair information and mailing label I was promised so I attempted to reach them on the Kodak support site using their chat function. When I logged into chat they said I was number one in the cue and that I would be helped by the next person available. I waited for 40 minutes until I was told that there was no support person available and to try back later.Next I used the support form on the Kodak support website. I filled out all the information and was told that I should hear from them within 48 hours. It has been six days and I have not heard a word from them. The camera is still not functioning and Kodak doesn't seem to care enough about their customers to even try to support the camera by following through on their promises.This is the third Kodak digital camera I have owned. I have also owned Canon and Nikon digital cameras. As of now I can not recommend this camera. Kodak support has been unresponsive to fixing there quality control issues. Your experience might vary, but then who knows? It pretty much depend on if you get a good camera or not. I would not take the chance again.There are many interesting features on this camera that I have not had a chance to test yet, The camera still has not had the defects repaired and Kodak support seems totally unresponsive. Apparently their warranty means nothing to them.

Reviews.Title: 14MP just fraud
Reviews.Author: tausif ahmad
Reviews.Content: 14MP is just fraud.bad picture quality.camera restart automatically.bad battery timing. buttons are too difficult to use. camera  mostly hanged.........waste much time to take a new picture.i think waste my money

Reviews.Title: no longer works
Reviews.Author: Tony Helton
Reviews.Content: After very little use with no abuse it quit working.  Kodak didn't care.  This turned out to be a POS.  I will not buy any more Kodak products.

Reviews.Title: Another great camera from Kodak - Kodak forever!
Reviews.Author: TP
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera for a while and having been using it since. I only have two words: Love it!It's another great camera/experience I've had with Kodak! I've been using a lot of different point-and-shoot cameras from different manufactures throughout the years, but I have to say Kodak is the best! Easy to use, quality built camera, great beautiful pictures, reasonable prices, and etc. What's not to like about it? I'm positive I'll have many great years with it, and I hope you will too!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Rosanna
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, nice and compact, 14 MP, great quality on all the pictures, not blur at all, nice zoom, Nice built-in sharing options, great rechargeable battery life, for the price and features i would say it's one of the best point and shoot cameras on the market, just remember that it only uses micro-SD cards. (I'll recommend getting at least a 4 GB micro SD)

Reviews.Title: This is a Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: buyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera especially for a Carribean vacation.  It was so inexpensive I thought it was going to be terrible for a big family vacation.  Wow, was I wrong.  This camera takes great photos and kept a great battery life.  Plus I got to spend more money on booze that I saved on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Kodak Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Dennis
Reviews.Content: Received this camera last week and so far we love it!  I had an older Kodak camera that has worked just great for the last 8 years till I dropped it!  SO I ordered another Kodak and am very pleased. Ours came with a micro SD card which was enclosed in an adapter that I believe some have mistaken for a regular SD sized card. The pictures looked great with the preset point and shoot values but I  changed the Focus/Exposure Zone to Center and the Color Mode to Full Color and the pictures look even better.  I will work with it more and experiment with which setting I like best, but it captures the kids great.  Others mentioned that the lag time between taking pictures is slow, but if you want to take continuous pictures - just gently press the shutter button (not all the way to actually take a picture)while it is displaying the picture you just took and it will clear the screen so you are ready to shoot again.  I am always taking pics of my 4 active kids and I can get every shot by doing this.  This camera is smaller than our last so I am careful to put the wrist strap on, I don't want to be dropping this one!  Thanks again Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the quality of this kodak easyshare camera. Its lightweight, & sleek,but most of all the quality of pictures are great! I have several younger children, so its always been difficult to get a nice picture that's NOT blurry since they are always on the move. BUT this camera takes good pics even if what you are taking a picture of is in motion! I'm very pleased!! The only thing I don't like about the camera is that it only takes a micro sd card (these are the super mini sd cards that are the size of a finger nail that are normally used in cell phones) And that in itself isn't really a big deal, just an inconvenience of having to buy a new sd card :)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Yanira
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband as a Chrismas gift...he loves it. It's small and compact and easy to carry around.  He especially loves that it snaps the pictures really fast so your eyes don't have time to react to the flash.

Reviews.Title: Just Arrived Today
Reviews.Author: lmt938
Reviews.Content: My Kodak M583 (purple) arrived today and so far I'm really loving it. The pictures are really clear and I love that the flash is really easy to change (it also has a feature to eliminate red eye). The color is really pretty, too. However the only complaints I have involve the memory card. One of the reviews mentioned that the MICRO SD card would not fit, and only a regular SD card would. This is incorrect, the product description is right. I mistakenly bought an SDHC card that I didn't need. My next complaint (but also a plus) was that the camera itself came with the correct memory card. This wasn't mentioned in the product description. My camera also came with a camera case, which again, wasn't mentioned. However, I still recommend buying a different camera case because the one provided isn't a hard case, therefore probably won't protect the camera if it were to fall.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera MICRO SD CARD needed.
Reviews.Author: Eileen A.
Reviews.Content: received this as a gift and it worked great. pictures were printed out right away and there was no problem uploading them. My only complaint is that YOU MUST purchase a Micro SD card. there is no internal memory on the camera to do any real pictures. other then that it's a fine little camera. (please amazon fix the accessory pics to include the micro SD card. thanks!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M583 14 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jose A Delgado
Reviews.Content: Brought it for my wife, she loves it. Simple to use and the pictures are down loaded quickly. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Excellent hardware, awful interface
Reviews.Author: 150 F3
Reviews.Content: After a week of photography, I love my M583 pictures. It is fully capable of creating wonderful, high quality 14 megapixel photos. Its HD video is superb.Unfortunately, one needs to use Program mode to achieve this. All the automatic modes are awful, with very, very bad overexposure and odd colors. The film effect modes aren't worth using, and should not have been included. They aren't even half baked.The worst thing about the camera is its unwieldy interface. Simple tasks like changing white balance (essential for partly cloudy days), using the self timer, and adjusting EV become tedious ordeals of menu and button pressing activity. The interface imprisons users instead of serving them. It's sleek, animated, and unresponsive. Many menus are bigger than the display and require scrolling, so stuff is needlessly hidden. I often press buttons two or three times, thinking it failed to respond, then have to correct the mistake when it overshoots what I intended. It's a pain. The tiny buttons require a lot of pressure and are difficult to use.I hate how any change from single shot mode only works once. If I'm doing long exposure photography at night, I'd like to have the 2 second delay stay on. The camera forces me to laboriously switch it on through the menus for each shot, which gets old fast. I'd like to do candid street photography in burst mode, but it only works once, forcing more menu activity. It's awful.There is no infinity focus option. I could not take a picture of the full moon, since the auto focus system apparently didn't bother to try focusing at infinity. Even if it did focus, center weighted metering didn't work and the moon was just a featureless white dot at EV -2.0.Optical image stabilization doesn't work well. Videos made with a tripod look shaky when the camera needlessly moves the entire frame to keep up with moving objects. Many photos taken in sunlight are shaky. I wish the camera designers realized that telephoto images need short shutter speeds. Kodak decided to bias the camera in favor of low ISOs instead. I'd love to get black and white telephoto images at grainy ISO 800, but so-called "Smart Capture" cannot do it. I'm exhausted just thinking about how much work it would be to adjust the camera to do it in Program mode.Every interface activity requires confirmation, then you have to press and press and press buttons to get back up to the top of the menu to close it, then press "DISP" to finally make the menu go away. The team that built the pathetically clumsy interface apparently was unfamiliar with real world photography in changing light. I'd rather take pictures than get lost in menus.(Technological fantasy: I wish there was a simple 3 tab interface. Tab 1 has aperture, shutter speed, white balance, and a choice between auto focus and manually set focus distance. Tab 2 has ISO, saturation, contrast, sharpness, delay, burst, and flash. Tab 3 has rarely needed things like the picture size, JPG quality, clock, formatting memory, sound volume, display brightness, and gimmicky automatic modes. Simple four way arrow buttons cycle through the options, which immediately go into effect and stay that way without confirmation. Kodak evidently feels slowing down photographers as much as possible with multiple menus and submenus is a better way to go.)I like how there is no video mode. It simply records video using the current settings, so smart capture and film effect modes will work to make arty H.264 MP4 files. Program mode works slightly better than Smart Capture, but white balance and EV choices look different and worse than still photos. "640x480" looks more like 320x160 interpolated to 640x480. 720p video frames are very blocky compared to stills scaled down to 1280x720.The M583 is very strong in certain situations. The T-MAX film effect is great with black, white, and silver subjects. Midtoned subjects in soft light always end up weak and horribly overexposed.I haven't seen any purple fringing yet. CCD blooming happened on some night video, but it wasn't too bad. The videos are very clear and noise free. They make beautiful 2D to 3D conversions with YouTube.The camera froze once and the lens failed to retract twice on the first full day of testing, so I'm not optimistic about its product life. I'll update the review if there are any problems.I love the treasures of photography and video this camera is giving me, but I can't overlook how much annoying effort is needed to get them. Canon and Pentax have figured out how to make camera adjustments easy. Why can't Kodak? I wish some company would simply make a pure black and white digital camera with a prime lens and one ISO only. The only adjustments (aperture, shutter speed, and focus distance) would be on manually operated dials. Digital engineers ruin and slow down everything with complexity.- - -Update after 1 month: I lowered the rating from 4 to 2 stars. I wanted to smash the camera against the ground yesterday. I want the camera to be out of my life. I hate how it insists on pointlessly displaying the mode name and how much storage space is left for 7 seconds every time it's turned on. I have good short term memory. I'm aware of what mode I'm using. I format the card after every session. I don't need that information blocking my view 100 times a day. It's bad enough that the information is forced onto the screen, but Kodak thoughtfully included black gradients to cover up even more of the image.The camera also froze after I thought I took a photo. It couldn't be turned off without opening the door and removing the battery. I hate this product. It is badly designed, poorly made, and a nightmare to use. Even when it works, video quality is horrible and still photos have way too much noise reduction. I'd love to make noisy ISO 400 - 800 black and whites in marginal light, but the camera wrecks them and won't let me get the results I want. Color photos in good light look weird thanks to flattened out detail the camera presumes is noise.I can't get used to the menu. If I leave the white balance, saturation, or ISO setting on one square, I expect it to be there when the menu is displayed again. The active square is always on the left, so I have to think carefully about which direction to move, since my current setting is not highlighted. It's a terrible interface.

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Yanez "Artist"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several brand named point and shoots as this camera but I love this one the most.It is so easy to use and as a professional photograper I love the compact size, One of my other cameras cost over $5,ooo.oo dollars just for the body and i will say that I love that camera too. But it is so big and heavy I only use it for special occations. This little Kodak has all I need to get great on the spot picks and the 8x zoom is all optical so it can get clear sharp pics zoomed in or out.Of all the Kodak Easyshares I've owned this one is the best. You don't have to be a professional to get great pics from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Karen Morris
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of this camera.  I don't get clear shots most of the time; I have to try to hard to be real steady.  I have an older model of a Kodak EasyShare that is bulkie now but that takes much better shots.  I would not recommend this camera.  I now use my phone w/camera more that I do this camera.  Also, i'm in the middle with the touch screen.  Some time I touch the feature that enables touch screen picture taking with out intending to enable it which results in me taking unintended photos.

Reviews.Title: Pro's Outweigh The Con's
Reviews.Author: Rachel Reeves "Zen, Vegetarian, Autodidact an...
Reviews.Content: Let me first say I have had a Kodak camera in the past and it served me well.  It was durable and took decent pictures for the price. So when it came to getting another camera after having the worst experience with Fujifilm camera, I decided I'd go back to Kodak.Here is what I found:Pro's:Takes Good PicturesQuiet shutterComes in nice colorsHas 8x optical zoom lensesThe price is rightIt is thin & fairly light weightHas mini USB for charging and downloading capabilities (I can use any mini USB cord including my blackberry cord.)It has several options for photo taking (Film Effects & Scene Modes etc.)Easy access photo & video record button for those random momentsLarge viewer screenTripod stand capableIt takes on average to charge from low battery to full about an 1hr.Decent battery life (I've found I only need to charge about 1 a week--I'm using it about 3-4 times a week for about 30mins or longer each time.Con's:Is not compatible with Twitter even though it claims it isDoes not come with a silicon case like previous modelsSlow to send to e-mail (May not send at all)Does not have a touch screenOver all, the camera is really good for the price.  However if your looking for something that you can send pictures wirelessly and flawlessly this might not be for you.  It does seem to lag and or not work at all in that department.  (I've only tired the e-mail and twitter share app.)  Despite the fact that I'm disappointed in the lack of wireless capabilities I do like the camera enough to over look that deception and I also feel there is enough pro's to outweigh the con's so I'm not 100 percent disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Easy point and shoot to use
Reviews.Author: dr.erskine
Reviews.Content: Fourteen big megapixels make shooting with this camera a breeze.  It has a nice big viewfinder and the zoom is sharp.  It's a real deal today.  A real nice size to fit in my pocket and take with me on every outing everyday.  The price is right for such a handy camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality picture and slow
Reviews.Author: Drz
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kodak digital camera I have purchased. This was to replace a Sony Point and Shoot. I gave it a fair chance , 9 months, let others use it and all had the same issue, consistent blurry pictures and takes too long to get ready for next picture. Warranty repair is now looking at it, sorry I cannot recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Feature Rich Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: JUST-JIM
Reviews.Content: I didnt have this camera more than 10 days before I returned it.The camera is easy to use for someone that is familiar with digitalcamera settings and, if the newbie downloads the complete manualthey will not have any problems using it.The pictures that it takesare razor sharp and I had no blurred pictures. Most of the complaintsof blurred pictures are mostly due to not pushing the shutter buttonhalfway in order to set the focus first before finally taking thepicture. The camera itself is quite small (shirt pocket size) andthe finish of the body is very glossy and slippery. If you have largehands, my advice is to look for something larger. The camera is quitehard to maneuver with large hands and you'll never know where yourfingers are, and generally their in the wrong place.This would be theideal camera for a female (with small hands) to keep in her purse.Unfortunatelythe lens would come halfway out and stop. Had to pop the battery andreset. Sometimes that would work and sometimes not. Other times itworked perfectly. Purchased another battery thinking maybe that was it.It wasn't. With the situation with Kodak, I didn't want to chance anotherand blow $118.00. I went for the Canon SX130IS from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with Kodak
Reviews.Author: camerafan
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my purchase of Kodak EasyShare M583. It is easy to use and easy to handle. Takes great photos and videos. EasyShare software makes downloading and printing photos so easy. Wide angle is great for taking group photos.

Reviews.Title: NOT new
Reviews.Author: aprilaura04
Reviews.Content: This item was anything but new. I knew it was a deal for $50 but it WAS advertised as NEW IN BOX, it was battered and obviously VERY USED but yes, in box (also very used).

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Swanlake
Reviews.Content: Great. I love it. Takes great pictures.The colors perfect. Eazy to hold. Pictures are very clear. Takes great indoor shots.

Reviews.Title: not Linux friendly
Reviews.Author: Leigh
Reviews.Content: Difficult with my operating system. Ubuntu Linux in particular can usually do plug and play even without accompanying software, but apparently Kodak refuses to do anything to make their products more compatible with Linux systems, even after repeated requests to do so. That's a shame, because this camera takes beautiful photos for the selling price. Also appears to reset itself to default settings when the camera is turned off, which is a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: Button Issue
Reviews.Author: tesha
Reviews.Content: Photos are lovely. Battery life is sufficient but there is an issue with my navigation buttons. I almost have to bite the buttons to navigate through my photos and when i reach a certain date in the photo folders, the camera freezes up and i have to remove the battery and reset the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: Camera Malfunctioned After 4 Days
Reviews.Author: A. Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased this vehicle just 5 days ago, but had to charge the battery. After charging I used it for 1 day - it took clear, crisp photos & I was able to download onto PC and online without a problem. Then the following day, I turned it on and the lens and LCD screen froze - the camera would not turn off & the lens would not retract. I had to remove battery for it turn off, but when i tried to retract the lens via the power button, it only retracted then extracted again and a black screen appeared. I completely charged the battery via the included charger in the wall for about an hour and still had the same problem. Contacted the extended warranty company as well as Kodak company (had problems getting to a support specialist at Kodak) to get a replacement, but have been unsuccessful thus far. Very frustrating to buy a new camera and not have it work - this is not due to the seller, but Kodak who does not support their customers.

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I am not in the least bit tech savvy...I want a point and click camera...and that is what I got.  The price is pretty good for a Kodak with this type of zoom and megapixal (according to a dear friend that always helps me out with techie stuff).  I have used it for a couple of weeks now and cannot truly complain.  I love the 'photo strip' feature and have taken several pictures of my kiddos that way--it's kind of like a fun photo booth whereever you are.  There is a slight delay after taking a photo and the battery life is alittle wanting compared to my old Kodak but this could just be that I didn't fully charge it before Christmas morning wrapping paper tornado hit my living room.Overall, very satisfied--gave it 4 Stars because of the delay after taking photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camara for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: staci g
Reviews.Content: love this camera !!!!lost my Nikon cool pic camera and didn t want to spend 400 dollars to replace it. This camera blows the Nikon away with its easy to use features.just point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Sleak and quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Holly Miller
Reviews.Content: I love the 'photo booth' feature on this camera!  It easily printed out photo strips that we could share.  The compact size packs a punch with easy to use features and a great 8x zoom.  Can't wait to use it over the holidays!

Reviews.Title: Works great so far...
Reviews.Author: D. Nelson
Reviews.Content: We are not real serious picture takers - just wanted a decent camera that will work and take nice pictures.  This camera really has a lot more modes than we'll ever use with Sepia, Color, B&W; and various different settings to try to capture the pictures in different situations (i.e. low light, action, etc.).  We haven't used it a ton in the first few months, but I've been impressed with the rechargeable battery - we haven't had to charge it up much, it seems to hold the charge for a while.  The software to load on our computer was pretty fast and definitely very easy.

Reviews.Title: m583 camera
Reviews.Author: cricket
Reviews.Content: camera works well, has a large viewing screen,easy controls, takes very sharp pictures, color is very accurate.  Overall a very good choice for a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Yet!
Reviews.Author: dt241
Reviews.Content: I haven't bought a camera for at least six years.  Owned a Kodak before and loved it so I continued with another Kodak and love this one even more.  Perfect size to carry in your purse.  Easy to use and pictures are high quality.  Would recommend to purchase.  Would definitely purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M583 Camera is... Easy!
Reviews.Author: Steven K. Malc "SteveM"
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift for my almost-daughter who has a 19-month old boy and likes to take lots of pictures of him. I needed a camera that is compact enough to fit in her purse or diaper bag, fast enough to catch a 19-month old in motion (without blurring, thank you...)and easy to use. The EasyShare M583 meets all those criteria, and adds a couple of bonuses, like an 8X Optical zoom. Most cameras in this price range offer alot of zoom, but optical zoom is what gives you sharp pictures and this camera has twice the amount of optical zoom as most cameras in its price range. It also offers image stabilization and takes pretty good video.The only cons I can think of are:- It uses a proprietary rechargeable battery, so if you run out of juice, you can't just run out and get a couple of Triple-A's to tide you over.- The body is mostly plastic. While it seems sturdy enough, I'd feel better with a metal body.In conclusion, this is a great camera for the money. I like it so much that as soon as I'm done writing this review, I'm buying another one as a gift for someone else.

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I received my Kodak EasyShare M583 14MP Digital Camera in Red last Wednesday and So far I LOVE IT!It does exactly what I need it to do. Nothing fancy, no flashing lights or ringing bells but perfect for me to use for memories with friends, family, vacations. Picture quality is clear I enjoy all the settings and features on this camera. I'll tell you one thing for $74.72 (a little over $85 after S&H; cost) YOU CAN'T BEAT IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: jimb
Reviews.Content: The camera takes excellent pictures, and is less than $100.00. Small compact, and has a nice size screen, to review your pictures. I take it with me on my trips to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Baba
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what it's name says, Easy.I love the size, pictures are clear, easy to share.The videos are fun also.  I like the long service batteries.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Its just as good as my last kodak, even better. I rarely have to touch the settings it adjust to what ever lighting and takes great pictures. It doesn't auto adjust to moving people or things though. I also tend to forget its not touch screen. But I love it. Start up time is quick, the battery life is much better than my samsung. It just would be better if it were touch screen

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th digital camera in 8 years. It is the cheapest one I've bought but also the best yet. These lenses are absolutely great. I only just got the camera today but already I have taken great pictures and just ordered a second one because my husband wants his own. I was pleasantly surprised when my box arrived and came with a case, MicroSD card and adapter, I thought I would have to buy those separately! My only worry for the future is that I will have the same problems I had with my past two kodak digital cameras, all had great picture quality but after 1-2 years the technological difficulties start like freezing, not recognizing sd cards, and the lens refusing to go back in when camera is off. This hasn't happened yet and my fingers are crossed that it wont! I also wish it would focus in the close up mode while zoomed in but it will not, close up only focuses if zoom is all the way out so no pictures of microscopic bugs for me!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera Performs Well
Reviews.Author: Leslie Adams
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare M583 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD - RedPurchased from Amazon.I am very pleased with my new Kodak camera.  It has performed very well and I would recommend it to friends.I am the Publicity Chair for my Bridge club so the Kodak camera comes in very handy.

Reviews.Title: nice but more complicated
Reviews.Author: D. Bertroch
Reviews.Content: Nice camera but more complicated than earlier models, buttons are small and easily confused and the Easy Share feature doesn't seem to work well (at all) - all that said, it can take great photos - so if great photos are what you're after, and a great small size is what you are looking for, it is a good camera

Reviews.Title: It is great
Reviews.Author: Manijeh Moghis
Reviews.Content: It does the job and is light and easy to use. I also like the price for a 14MP 8Xoptical zoom

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ronald Weaver
Reviews.Content: Works great . Was a just what I needed no problem with it.Price was right .Easy to use would buy more if and when I need them.

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: karen l steffens
Reviews.Content: The pictures have a halo in the upper right corner.  Size of a nickle and shadowed.  All I want is to exchange it for a new one & I cannot fine a form or anywhere to state that intent.  I had started a return but had not  thought I  submitted & Fed Ex came for a pick up and & wasn't ready.  I just want to exchange but I do not have  the original packing. I'm upset with Amazon, being a Prime Member, that I have to waste my time with this.  For improved customer service I would advise Amazon look into their 3rd party return policy, especially when the return is due to a faulty product.  Amazon took my money, not the 3rd party, Amazon ought to make good.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: really cool camera
Reviews.Author: jw
Reviews.Content: this camera works great. small convenient size. takes great pictures and video.  software is seamless.  love the built incapability to emulate old kodak films.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M583
Reviews.Author: Bette J. Bibee
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! Bought it to replace office camera at our real estate office. All personnel are familiar with the user friendliness of the other Kodak Easyshare cameras we have used previously and this does not disappoint. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Marisela Villegas
Reviews.Content: Excellent product i highly recommend very good.i loved it. What we wanted. Very good everything I expected. comprenlo - guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: froze up
Reviews.Author: Carrie Piotrowski
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for one year and it has froze up.....I went to radio shack and bought a battery for $40---half of what this camera cost......put the new battery in and the camera froze up again after 3 hours......what a waste of money

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: alwaysreading
Reviews.Content: Really love this camera, takes really nice pictures and is easy to use. When you purchase it, don't forget to order the mini memory card for it!

Reviews.Title: My Views
Reviews.Author: Eric Reinagel
Reviews.Content: I usually take about 150 to 200 pictures a day three to four days a week. The weight and quality of the camera and pictures are fine, The issue I have is the freezing of the picture frame where you have to take out the battery to reset the system which happens two or three times a day. Even with that I'm disappointed to see Kodak leaving the camera business.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: James A. Dunaway
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations. Simple to use, lots of features and the best thing of all is that you can see the lcd screen in direct sunlight!

Reviews.Title: Sort of disatisfied
Reviews.Author: Maribel Flores
Reviews.Content: Just due to the camera not looking that great when taking pictures but overall good have used it several times on different occasions and works good.

Reviews.Title: Requires "Micro" SD/SDHC card
Reviews.Author: John W. Wagonis "doctor"
Reviews.Content: Be aware of the suggestive add on items for this camera.  It requires a micro memory card, the slot is very tiny for the card to fit in.  The suggestive add on was not the micro memory card.  So on the suggestion of the seller, I bought the wrong card.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good results
Reviews.Author: Joan De Yoreo
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because of its useability, compactness, it takes nice sharp photos, The menu is easily maneuverable. I had an earlier model but it took a swim in my daughter's back pocket one day and drowned.

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera, good
Reviews.Author: Arline Wagner
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera.  Had a kodak easy share and like the product and the easy use of the camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: erica woods
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and am very disappointed that Kodak will no longer be making cameras. This camera takes excellent quality photos, and the price can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Samsung
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera,nice design,looks and feels great on your hands,shinny finish and great features,pictures are nice and vivid...flash is also great,I can't complaint since it is a bit small,I bought this for my wife and she loves it,will recomend any product from Kodak any giving time.

Reviews.Title: Love Kodak Digital Camera's
Reviews.Author: Maggie Mae 427
Reviews.Content: They are so easy to operate. Compared to others. This is the third one I've had. I recommended getting one.

Reviews.Title: Everything is perfect! Thank you very much!
Reviews.Author: Konstantin
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect! Thank you very much! That is what I wanted! I will definitely enjoy using this item and I hope it is very useful!

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Gigi
Reviews.Content: purchased it for my father for christmas! he loved it. kodak products never fail... its def a great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: Out of business
Reviews.Author: karljohn
Reviews.Content: Since Kodak is not making cameras any more and I love the one I had. It was nice finding a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Kersey
Reviews.Content: This camera was a good fit for me.  I just wanted something simple to operate and it is very easy to navigate the screen.  The screen is not too small, a nice size.  The camera fits right in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: christmas present
Reviews.Author: gamer
Reviews.Content: its a sturdy feeling camera, charging didnt seem that long, i just charged it when i got it from the box . its will fit right in my wifes purse pocket which is great

Reviews.Title: takes great pics
Reviews.Author: Michael P. McGarvey
Reviews.Content: bought for granddaughter and he love it and well not put it down  he is very happy with this product

Reviews.Title: Got all I need with this camera
Reviews.Author: Lubushka
Reviews.Content: Kodak M583 14MP EASYSHARE DIGITAL CAMERA is all I need for my pictures to work with. I used to have Kodak cameras from previous generation but this one is obvious plus compare to all my cameras in past. I love 8 times optical zoom but when I learned that I can charge the buttery through computer right when I download picks I fall in love with this camera! No more AAs, rechargeable or not, it is such a release (!) because it means no more extra time, hassles and expenses related to maintaining batteries. Also I love extended options to take picture under different conditions, it really helps to have picks look better and I can manage these options easily even without glasses, which is important for me. If you need to take a real quick shot, option camera for sport event and you will get a chance to pass delay that you have in default option. Yea, and wide angle is a definite plus as well, you can take much better detailed interior picks.

Reviews.Title: Great color!
Reviews.Author: mary ann moore
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to be able to get a Kodak camera before they were all gone.  I have had 2 easy shares and I have loved both of them.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M583
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Actually, it's my fiance loving the camera. This was a gift I gave to her on her b-day. She and her family uses this always on events and occasions. Pictures are clear and the 8x Optical Zoom is a killer.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Maureen Weaver
Reviews.Content: I received my camera and really liked it. I was taking pictures outside and had never used the flash.  When I neded it - it didn't work.  I tried everything but it just did work.  Unfortunately the time for return had passed and now I am stuck with a camera I can only use outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easy share M583
Reviews.Author: Topo2
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Very accessible and easy to use. Only fours stars cause the speed to focus it's not that fast for a portable camera. It has to be very still so it can shoot a nice picture. Besides from that everything else works fine. The delivery was the two day shipping and it arrived as expected.

Reviews.Title: very pleased with Amazon purchase and $$$
Reviews.Author: Carol G
Reviews.Content: This camera is a replacement for an 8 yr. old Easy Share and it has fulfilled my expectations. It is, for me, a perfect size without minute controls. All features are user friendly. I do miss the view finder but am quickly adjusting. My only 2 minor issues are the teensy weenie micro camera card which seems unnecessary and photo review only goes from oldest to most recent and the you have to go all the way back to start over. My previous model would continue in the same forward direction from newest to oldest. But yes, I would definitely purchase another Easy Share product if they are still available in the future.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: YAH
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that was easy to use, and the Kodak EasyShare is it.  Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: ContainerGardenGirl
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't had this product long, it appears to work well and is small enough to fit in a purse or small bag.  However, I was disappointed to find out that you cannot automatically have the date placed on your picture or video.  You must go back after the picture or video has been taken to add the date.

Reviews.Title: New Camera from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Veronica Burke
Reviews.Content: I lost my camera and all the pictures of my niece's graduation. I was devastated and needed a camera. I've used this camera only a few times, but love it, it's perfect and takes great pictures. A valued purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: The Big Giant Head
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pics. Video looks good during the day but night is not so good because there is no video light. The camera is very lite and has good battery life.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jason Oldfield
Reviews.Content: Title says it all...I bought this camera for my 9 year old daughter who wanted one of those cheap digital video cameras.  I bought this instead from Amazon for under $70, and it is a great little camera for the money.  The pictures are clear, high-resolution, and the camera has a nice optical zoom / image stabilization system.  In addition, it INCLUDES A MEMORY CARD AND A CASE!  I looked online beforehand to try to verify this and could not, so I ended up ordering a memory card from Amazon too (that's now in the Wii).  In the end, you really can't go wrong with this camera for the price.So, why did I only give it 4 stars?  For 2 reasons - First the auto-share button only has limited functionality...I tried to upload a video to YouTube using the Share button, and it said it was no longer supported (it also no longer supports Twitter or Flickr).  Second, the warranty on this camera is going to be serviced through a 3rd party since Kodak is in bankruptcy and exiting the digital camera business.  That's not great, but honestly it is unlikely that the camera will break in the next year unless my daughter drops it, and even if it does break and I can't get it serviced under the warranty, I'm not going to lose too much sleep over it considering I bought it for less than $70.  Otherwise, this camera is great, and I'm sorry to see Kodak leaving the business as it is clear they CAN make a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easy share M583 bundle
Reviews.Author: dougie
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera bundle on july 11,2012 and received it july 13 2012! As usual Amazon came through with flying colors again!!! This little camera has the biggest bang for the buck that I have found. I have only had it for a few days and I can already tell you its worth more than I paid for it!Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: KimLaw
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, I got it in the desired color and with the relevant accessories. The camera was bought at a reasonable price so I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: truth seeker "ts"
Reviews.Content: I've only had it for a month, but I absolutely love this product.  The color is beautiful. Memory is portable & versatile with its adaptor.  The only tiny thing is that the screen commands move seconds slower than I would like, but that's just me.  It takes great pics & I would recomend this product to anyone, especially since Kodak won't be making anymore!

Reviews.Title: No date stamp
Reviews.Author: Rick N.
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that there is no date stamp feature. Otherwise, I like the macro feature and the long exposure feature.

Reviews.Title: not for joint problems or fat fingers
Reviews.Author: angie  C
Reviews.Content: I went to replace my old easyshare which I have raved about for five yrs. I picked this one without even looking at the competition. I miss the picture window view finder which I loved. The buttons are ridiculously tiny and if you have arthritis or joint problems please don't pick this camera because it is only for the small, nimble-fingered type. I would have given it a 3.5 but I was comparing it to the camera I had loved so well. The zoom is great and the definition, pix quality I would rate 4. Sadly, I'm probably going to be shopping for another camera and giving this one away to someone with small nimble fingers.

Reviews.Title: NOVICE
Reviews.Author: ME
Reviews.Content: PURCHASED THIS CAMERA TO REPLACE A LARGER KODAK I HAD IT DOES A GREAT JOB AND IS EASIER TO CARRY. THE PRICE WAS RIGHT BUT THE SCANDISK OFFERED WITH PURCHASE IS NOT THE RIGHT ONE AS IT TAKES A MICRO SCANDISK.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Uceny De La Paz
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a nice new camera, for a nice price of course. I saw this Kodak with all these accessories and the price, so I bought it. The first time I used it I notice how fast and how neat this camera took the pictures. Every time I want to make a purchase, Amazon is one of the best places I found is perfect for a serious purchase. This camera has been a good asset. Thank you people from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Not really fascinated....
Reviews.Author: ericmarcushopkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the intention that one could "easily share" photos on social media. But to my dismay, one can only do it through a personal computer or laptop, like any other camera or smartphone.It takes great pictures and I bought it at a reasonable price, but why call it an "EasyShare" when it doesn't do anything that my Android can't do? Because you're able to upload photos to the Kodak social media website? I STILL don't see the advantage in that. I don't know too many people who take pictures and can't wait to upload and share them on "Kodak.com."I'm extremely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: biased with Kodak
Reviews.Author: NellyMa32115
Reviews.Content: from my first Kodak camera I've always been biased. Love the quality of the photo and the screen is just so wide. the lens catches everything. VERY user-friendly too. Had to buy another one after I wet my 1st one. The tripod works wonderfully with it too. Also love the memory card. One thing I wish I would have known was that it comes with accessories that I didn't need to buy like a memory card and case ... then I wouldn't have spent money buying a memory card. So I definitely recommend THIS buy.

Reviews.Title: quality camera
Reviews.Author: Horace Wilson
Reviews.Content: For the price you will be hard pressed to be this camera. It has the 14 megapixels and a 8x optical zoom. I don't need a fancy camera and this one works fine for the occasional use for when I need it.

Reviews.Title: One of the best in this price range
Reviews.Author: Gkcmilner
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my son during a Woot-off. He loves it and I am impressed enough to buy another one. Can't beat it for the price (under seventy dollars)! The optical image stabilization with the long zoom range works great. The wide angle lens and the strong flash takes nice indoor pics. The camera is MUCH better than the Nikon Coolpix S3100 that I bought that is in the same price range. I also like that you can charge it using standard USB ports. What I don't care for is the Micro SD format and the high gloss finish. I also wish it came with a case.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M583
Reviews.Author: Andrea Wehrenberg
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my daughter.  She loves it!  And she loves the fact that it's purple!!!  Camera works great.  The only misperception was that it takes standard SD card, well it doesn't.  It only takes the mini.  Thank goodness we had an extra one laying around or she wouldn't have been able to use it Christmas day.  Other than that it is exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Crbark2u
Reviews.Content: Camera is light weight and easy to use. I carry it in My pocket where ever I go can't tell the difference from cell phone.The wide to tele. is slow response that would be My only complaint. Like how easy pictures and videos up load .

Reviews.Title: slightly disappointing
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: i really do love the camera, but it takes pictures very slow, every time i take one it says processing. i love the features and the quality will surly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M583
Reviews.Author: N. Rappenecker
Reviews.Content: I just received the camera today. Smartly designed and looks beautiful. Followed the instructions and installed the battery and the 16GB MicroSD card. I purchased the MicroSD card separately. Pay attention to the battery alignment and the MicroSD card. The card only fits one way. The MicroSD card is tiny. Next, the wrist strap installation. Its hard to fit the loop thru the camera body. I used a wire tie to pull the loop thru. I charged the battery; it took about 4 hours. Now I can practice taking pictures. I will write more on this later.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: My husband loves the way this takes pics. It is the second Kodak he has owned. This was one of his favorite gifts

Reviews.Title: Don't hesitate
Reviews.Author: A. Ward "AKW"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for my girlfriend. She needed a new camera and wanted the color purple. This was the first choice for me. The price was great, 14MP was perfect, and large screen in back. The only thing I would have wanted would have been touch screen. But again for the price this camera cannot be beat. Pictures are crisp and clear. Camera is easy to use and durable.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: ccarley
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with an Auto-date/time stamp.Just what we needed to our equipment facilities.However, it does not charge using the USB cable.You have to remove the battery and plug the charge into the wall.I recommend getting an extra battery if you use the camera a lot/everyday.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I had just a couple of days to get familiar with the camera before my son's graduation. I found it very easy to use and I like the fact it has 8x zoom. I did find that in an inside setting if I zoomed in too far the picture darkened.  I also reallly like the fact it has a seperate button for the video so you can instantly record. The picture is very clear. I recently took the camera with me camping and took pictures out the truck window while we were moving and the pictures turned out great. I haven't tried the easy share button yet, that's next.  I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for this price!
Reviews.Author: Carrillo Commerce
Reviews.Content: The pictures come out really clear, compact size easy to fit on any purse, the battery life just for pictures taking is pretty long, I only charge once a month and I am out taking at least 100 pictures.Easy to download the pictures on computer. I would buy it for a friend or relative as a gift.

Reviews.Title: As advertised.
Reviews.Author: Toon
Reviews.Content: This camera has most of the features I was looking for at a good price. The only complaint I have is that it is hard to time date stamp the pictures but for the price I paid and the features it has, I still give it five stars.

Reviews.Title: a kids review
Reviews.Author: T. A. Morrison
Reviews.Content: this product is great. if your a kid whose sister or mom is tired of you using their camera for extremely danger es films such as balancing it on a board over a pond jest to jump over it and holding it in your mouth to parkor or free run then this is a great buy. shortly after i bought this item i went to six flags and brought it on Goliath and Superman amazing with its HD filming copacetic the videos where amazing.PRO.takes great videos and pitchers. the videos are clean and amazing and the sound is greatCON. buttons are a litel hard to push at first and when you zoom in and out the video gets a litel bleary.over all this is a great litel camera and it has served its master well  PS  are video is on you tub titled six flags Goliath and Superman it is easier to find on igoogles front page .

Reviews.Title: Had low expectations, but still disappointed
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer and I don't consider myself someone with high expectations for photographs, so I was surprised to find myself disappointed with this purchase.  The pictures are either blurry or dull.  I just want to be able to capture scenes as my eyes see images -- no need to have perfect lighting -- but this camera could not do the job.  I am aware of making sure to not take pictures with backlighting, of overly bright scenes, etc., but even with the extra quick-button camera settings, I was always disappointed with my shots.  The camera is also really slow.  It takes nearly 2 seconds for it to do anything, e.g. switching to picture-viewing mode, or switching camera modes.  I don't demand quick snapping pictures, so it doesn't affect my picture-taking, but it tries your patience.  The coating on the camera also scratches easily.  I don't mind that so much, but I was surprised that my camera looks so worn with only 1 week of mild use.Because the images taken are of such poor quality, I always ask my friends to use their cameras rather than mine and I always find myself apologizing for images taken with this camera.  Disappointed.  Not happy even though it was a "cheap" camera.  I should have spent the extra $80 on a better reviewed camera.

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: Charlie Ernst
Reviews.Content: The pitcures are excellant and the videos are also better than expected.  I put the internetconnection for the manual in my task bear and it's very available and no problem.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Winklemanv
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, clear picture and lots of different photo settings. The video quaility on this camera is great! Shipping was also great, I recieved this item the day after I bought it! Would recommend...

Reviews.Title: My Kodak easyshare kctrb12911964
Reviews.Author: Virginia Davis
Reviews.Content: It is not quite as simple to use as my old one.  I droped it and messed it up. I threw it away and don't remember the model.

Reviews.Title: Broken item.
Reviews.Author: Osmer Contreras
Reviews.Content: When I receive the camera, the scream was broken, I had to sent it to kodak customer service in order to get a repair and I have to paid for it.

Reviews.Title: 14 megapixel doesn't mean anything!
Reviews.Author: Adam J. Roubitchek "roubitcube"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is TERRIBLE.  I was worried that we had the settings set incorrectly, but then realized that there is NO customization of the settings.  There is a reason this camera is so cheap.  Not to mention EZ-Share is a ridiculous concept.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great camera
Reviews.Author: Jarwrat "Jamdowner"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought as a present no complaints as yet seems to be a good camera, a bit light and plasticish.

Reviews.Title: They just keep getting better and better.
Reviews.Author: Richard H "techno geek"
Reviews.Content: I was a "high end snob" needing an SLR camera.Now I am one of those people that use a compact, point and shoot camera.NOT for the usual reasons.Pocketable is a real plus, but there are other reasons.High megapixel resolution.Advanced zoom ranges.Lower cost.This camera gives me a high resolution (for this date) and a very capable zoom range.  Without the cost of a high end SLR!Replace your camera every year or two at a cost slightly in excess of $100 and you will not feel like you are in the "back of the pack" when you are using it.  Much better than spending $500 or therabouts.Bonus features are the face recognition and the "Facebook" connection.

Reviews.Title: I love it !
Reviews.Author: LM
Reviews.Content: I recently got this camera, I was using a Sony for many years , and I was so happy but I decided to change because I want one with a big optical Zoom so I so this Kodak that have all that I want I bough it ! I didn't used a lot yet but so far I'm happy with the  quality pictures , is easy to use quick to take many pictures with out wait, the only that is a little difficult is the sweep picture because you have to take in three times and take s long also yo have to setup one picture with the other one , so you really can't sweep all in one to take the picture, but I don't sweep all the time , I got a 16G card because I dont have to worry when I want to make videos also.So far I'm very happy with this Digital camara and the price is not that bad comparing with other ones in the market and all that this one give you !

ProductInfo.Features:
Zoom in tight or stay wide with the 8X wide optical zoom lens
Dedicated video record button, 720p HD video, on-camera editing
One-button upload to e-mail, KODAK PULSE Display and other popular social networking sites
Li-Ion rechargeable battery and MICROSD/MICROSDHC card slot
Add up to 4 GB of memory and be prepared to record your memories at a moments notice
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak EasyShare M583 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD - Black
